Verses.1: "For the Kingdom of Heaven is like a landowner who went out early in the morning to hire workers for their vineyard.
Verses.2: The owner agreed with the workers on a wage of a denarius for the day. And the workers were sent into the vineyard."
Verses.3: "And the owner went out around the third hour and saw others standing idle in the marketplace,
Verses.4: and told them, 'You go into my vineyard also, and I will pay you whatever is right.' And so they went."
Verses.5: "Again, the owner went around the sixth and ninth hours and did the same.
Verses.6: And around the eleventh hour they went out and found others standing around. So they asked them, 'Why have you  been standing here all day doing nothing?'"
Verses.7:
"They responded to him, 'because no one hired us.'"
	"The owner said to them, 'You go into the vineyard too.'"
Verses.8: "When evening came, the owner of the vineyard said to his manager, 'Call the workers and pay them their wages, starting with the last and to the first.'"
Verses.9: "The workers hired around the eleventh hour came up, each one received a denarius.
Verses.10: So when those hired first came up, they thought that they would receive more. But each one of them also received a denarius.
Verses.11: When they received their wage they grumbled at the landowner.
Verses.12: Saying, 'Those who were hired last worked only one hour. And you made them equal to us who borne the burden of the day's work with its sweltering heat.'"
Verses.13: "But he replied to one of them, 'Friend, I am not doing wrong by you, did you not agree to work for a denarius?
Verses.14: Take what is yours and go. I want to give to those hired last the same as you.
Verses.15: Is it not my right to do what I want with my own money? Or are you envious because I am generous?'"
Verses.16: "So the last will be first, and the first will be last."
